metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Psalm 130: Out of the Depths

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems humanity from a state of self-destructive estrangement and 'primordial catastrophe' where no human merit exists.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop
The God who pursues us even beyond the grave
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'Miserable Offender'

zender.identificatie: The Triune Nature of God (Inner core of being)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Miserable Offender' / The Church / The Hearer

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Human Resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as a 'catastrophe' and 'ontological self-destruction' that renders the human Subject totally incompetent (unable to stand).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and 'fear of the Lord' as a result of being found by Grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Honesty and Worship (The Fear of the Lord)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (confession) is only possible because the primary program (forgiveness) is already a reality ('There is forgiveness with you; therefore you shall be feared').

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
God... whose nature it is to give
knowledge that he and everyone else is a 'miserable offender'
total inability to present ourselves righteous

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the total lack of 'Pouvoir' (power) in the human subject and the absolute 'Pouvoir' of God to act where man cannot.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (The Depths) to the realization that ~S1 (Merit) is impossible, finally resting in S1 (Grace) which creates a 'Fear of the Lord' that is not S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the character of God (Trinity) who bridges the gap between the depths and the dawn.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation and defines the human condition as one of total incapacity, making grace the only logical engine of the narrative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human figures (parents/Paul) are used as 'hints' or 'glimmers' of God's action, not as models to be imitated by the hearer's own strength.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats them theocentrically: Paul's agony reflects God's agony.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief, gratitude, and 'fear' (awe) rather than pressure to perform.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is entirely of God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'depths' of the law/sin to the 'heights' of Trinitarian grace is logically and narratively seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'miserable offender' and 'beloved child'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: fellowship of the Holy Spirit... dynamic interrelatedness

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' that brings the hearer into the life of God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject, Grace is the Object, and the Hearer is the Receiver.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the current focus on the hearer as the one 'pursued'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this; it is the antidote to moralism.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon perfectly exemplifies the 'Grammar of Grace' by keeping God as the Subject of the active verbs and treating human response as a fruit of divine initiative.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the parenting metaphors, Greimas shows these metaphors function to define the Subject's (God's) character, not the hearer's duty.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Trinity; semiotics shows the Trinity in action as a 'self-giving' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Fear of the Lord' is a modal competence (Savoir/Vouloir) granted by the Sender, not a work produced by the Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'miserable offender' language to strip the human subject of all 'Pouvoir-faire', forcing a reliance on the Divine Subject.
